item.title: Deanna add a quote by Albert Schweitzer
item.description: "In the hopes of reaching the moon men fail to see the flowers that blossom at their feet." -- Albert Schweitzer

item.title: Deanna add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "If you don't have time to read, you don't have the time (or the tools) to write. Simple as that." -- Stephen King

item.title: Deanna add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "I think that we're all mentally ill. Those of us outside the asylums only hide it a little better - and maybe not all that much better after all." -- Stephen King

item.title: Deanna add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "If you want to be a writer, you must do two things above all others: read a lot and write a lot." -- Stephen King

item.title: Deanna add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "The scariest moment is always just before you start." -- Stephen King

item.title: Deanna add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "The thing under my bed waiting to grab my ankle isn't real. I know that, and I also know that if I'm careful to keep my foot under the covers, it will never be able to grab my ankle." -- Stephen King

item.title: Deanna add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Monsters are real, and ghosts are real too. They live inside us, and sometimes, they win." -- Stephen King

item.title: Deanna add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Alone. Yes, that's the key word, the most awful word in the English tongue. Murder doesn't hold a candle to it and hell is only a poor synonym." -- Stephen King

item.title: Deanna add a quote by William Sleator
item.description: "I learn more from books than from people" -- William Sleator

item.title: Deanna add a quote by Anne Rice
item.description: "Evil is always possible. And goodness is eternally difficult." -- Anne Rice

item.title: Deanna add a quote by Quentin R. Bufogle
item.description: "99% of all problems can be solved by money -- and for the other 1% there's alcohol." -- Quentin R. Bufogle

item.title: Deanna add a quote by Thornton Wilder
item.description: "Now he discovered that secret from which one never quite recovers, that even in the most perfect love one person loves less profoundly than the other. There may be two equally good, equally gifted, equally beautiful, but theremay never be two that love one another equally well." -- Thornton Wilder

item.title: Deanna add a quote by Thornton Wilder
item.description:
"That’s what it was like to be alive. To move about in a cloud of ignorance; to go up and down trampling on the feelings of those...of those about you. To spend and waste time as though you had a million years. To be always at the mercy of one self-centered passion, or another. Now you know- that’s the happy existence you wanted to go back to. Ignorance and blindness.
-Simon Stimson, OUR TOWN" -- Thornton Wilder

item.title: Deanna add a quote by Thornton Wilder
item.description: "It’s when you’re safe at home that you wish you were having an adventure. When you’re having an adventure you wish you were safe at home." -- Thornton Wilder

item.title: Deanna add a quote by Thornton Wilder
item.description: "Good-by, Good-by, world. Good-by, Grover's Corners... Mama and Papa. Good-by to clocks ticking... and Mama's sunflowers. And food and coffee. And new-ironed dresses and hot baths...and sleeping and waking up. Oh, earth, you're too wonderful for anybody to realize you." -- Thornton Wilder

item.title: Deanna add a quote by Thornton Wilder
item.description: "The knowledge that she would never be loved in return acted upon her ideas as a tide acts upon cliffs." -- Thornton Wilder

item.title: Deanna add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "The one you love and the one who loves you are never, ever the same person." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Deanna add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "It's so hard to forget pain, but it's even harder to remember sweetness. We have no scar to show for happiness. We learn so little from peace." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Deanna add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "What I want is to be needed. What I need is to be indispensable to somebody. Who I need is somebody that will eat up all my free time, my ego, my attention. Somebody addicted to me. A mutual addiction." -- Chuck Palahniuk
